body:
I made a comparison of breezily • AltShit • Double AltShiftbridging using tickrate changer mod to make the time slower, yes, I restaur the time to the normal after doing it.

here are the comparison:
https://youtu.be/dkViVBEuo6k
PD: 35 blocks bridges


the results are:

Breezily.-slowest
AltShit.-second
Double AltShift .- first

Why AltShit is faster than Breezily lmao?
becuase i do the AltShit Bridge pressing shit shortly.

what is Double AltShift
i discover this bridging Technique two weecks ago, is the fastest and is easier than breezily why? Because bridging sideways (pressing A&S or D&S is faster than just pressing just S) .

i made this comparicion using tickrate changer, yes but these results are definitly replicable in real games.

why is so hard to do it consistently?
well minecraft works at 20ticks per second, that means minecraft adds 50ms of inputlag and only register actions (pressing a key or realising it) at intervals of 50ms if you pres a key during less than 50ms minecraft wont register it, if u realise a key after 60ms of pessing it minecraft will register the key realse at 100ms after it has register the press. sadly this afect pvp to. ):

the other reason of why is so hard to do it consistently is that hixboxes are square shaped and no rounded, if it has rounded it would be easyer.

replies.body:
altshift is alternating betting shifting and no shifting, is how everyone do bridges this days.

double altshift is the same thing but shifting shortly every two blocks.
